We can generate UI only using CBO app like section 3.A and add the generated app to the custom fiori technical / business catalog.
But I cannot find how to transport the generated UI object which is in a local package for key user extensibility.
Do you have any solutions how to transport UI object that is generated by custom business object app?

entry.title: Re: how can I create data action step to copy version in SAC
entry.content: Not sure what's your real difficulty here. You can directly use data copy step in data action to achieve that. If you want to backup into a different version, you need to have two different data actions since one data action can only operate on target version. Then you need a multi-action to link two data actions.

entry.title: Re: ABAP2XLSX alternative in Public Cloud
entry.content:
I ended up generating the Excel file on the frontend side using JavaScript. It's surprising that SAP still doesn’t provide a proper tool for such a widely needed feature like working with Excel (in Public Cloud).

@Sandra_RossiI tried, but it’s actually not very easy to adapt ABAP2XLSX for Public Cloud. There are many restrictions—some classes and data types aren’t supported in Public Cloud. This leads to cascading errors like 'XXX is not permitted,' which then forces you to create your own Z-version of the object.

entry.title: SAP Stammtisch Brisbane - “Tech & Beach Vibes – SAP in the Sun”
entry.content:
You are invited!!

Escape the dashboards and dive into island vibes with Brisbane’s SAP community. This month, we’re mixing business with beachside banter - no powerpoints, no suits, just smart minds and good times.

🎟️ Cost: Free – just bring your best SAP story and a thirst for connection

Theme: Tech & Beach Vibes
We’re celebrating the systems that keep things moving - and the people who make them sing. Expect laid-back networking, unexpected insights, and maybe a pineapple garnish or two.

Why Attend?

  • Meet fellow SAP pros, platform nerds, newbies to SAP and transformation trailblazers
  • Swap stories, share wins, and laugh about the bugs that got away
  • No pressure. No pitches. Just real talk and real people

Dress Code: Tropical flair encouraged—think florals, linen, or your best tropical vibes🌺

NOTE - if you cannot find us - please check with the concierge or look for the blow up palm tree.

Cannot register HTTP client: An error occurred while configuring the OAuth token.
OTR-based exception – Class: /SDF/CX_CALM_CONNECTOR

CX_CTS_REST_API_NO_LOG_OBJECT

object not found

Error class for debugger batch activation
CX_ABDBG_BTCAT_INTERNAL
Internal error for debugger batch activation

entry.title: 404 on /samlsinglesignon/saml/SSO in Hybris SAML SSO setup
entry.content:
I am trying to enable SAML SSO for the storefront in SAP Commerce 2211.41. (Not Spartacus site) 

I am implementing SAML SSO in SAP Commerce (Hybris) using the samlsinglesignon extension.
I have added the extension in localextensions.xml and configured local.properties (entityId, metadata, keystore, etc.).

I also created a SAMLController with /samlsinglesignon/ssologin that redirects to /samlsinglesignon/saml/SSO.

When I hit /samlsinglesignon/ssologin, it redirects correctly to /samlsinglesignon/saml/SSO, but that request returns 404 Not Found.

My suspicion is that the Spring Security filter chain for /samlsinglesignon/** is not active in my storefront.

What exactly needs to be added in the storefront’s *-spring.xml or *-security-spring.xml to register the SAML filters (samlFilter, samlEntryPoint, etc.) from the samlsinglesignon extension, so that /samlsinglesignon/saml/SSO is handled by the SAML stack instead of returning 404?

Also, do we need to explicitly import classpath:/samlsinglesignon/spring/security-saml.xml into the storefront context?

Can you guide me to resolve my issue? 

Reference snippet : 

@Controller
@RequestMapping("/samlsinglesignon")
public class SAMLController {
    @RequestMapping(value = "/ssologin", method = RequestMethod.GET)
    public void startSsoLogin(HttpServletRequest request, HttpServletResponse response) throws IOException {
        response.sendRedirect(request.getContextPath() + "/samlsinglesignon/saml/SSO");
    }

Thanks!

entry.title: Re: (Re)using Master Operations in SAP Digital Manufacturing
entry.content:
Hi @ManoelCosta and @michael_koerner3 ,

I'm testing the transfer of the field SAP ME Operation Data from routings into production orders in S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition and the expected result is that the field SAP ME Operation Data should be automatically copied from the routing into the order operation, however the field remains blank in the production order operation, causing an impact.

This breaks integration with SAP Digital Manufacturing, since operation mapping cannot be identified without the SAP ME Operation Data reference. 

I've maintained the value for this field in my routing, also production version exists referencing this routing and BOM.

So, can you please confirm whether:

  • SAP ME Operation Data is supported for automatic transfer in S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.
  • If yes, advise on corrective action or apply a fix.
  • If no, confirm if this is a product limitation for S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition. In the meantime, I'm currently working with a workaround in DM with production processes.

Thank you for your support.

Cheers,
Bruno

entry.title: Re: Rebates
entry.content:
From the screen shot of the error message which you shared, and to brief you why VBOF shows “No Correction Due to Value Change”, is because, this message typically appears when:

  • the pricing procedure has changed after the billing document was created.
  • A rebate-relevant condition type (like Z209) was removed, marked statistical, or excluded.
  • VBOF compares the current pricing procedure with the one used during billing — and if the condition is missing, it assumes no correction is needed.

In your case, invoices created before June 2024 used Z209, but the current pricing procedure no longer includes it — so VBOF skips accrual updates.

SAP Notes 1498158 and 1023925 explain that VBOF won’t update billing documents if the pricing procedure has changed in a way that affects rebate conditions. VBOF relies on program SDBONT06, which compares old and new pricing conditions. If Z209 is missing in the current config, it won’t trigger an update.

Below are couple of options to rectify the issue

Option 1: Temporarily Reintroduce Z209 in Pricing Procedure
Revert the pricing procedure to include Z209 (even if inactive or statistical). Run VBOF again for rebate agreement 31286. Once accruals are updated, you can remove Z209 again. This is the least disruptive and most SAP-aligned solution.

Option 2: Use Debugging to Identify Condition Mismatch
Set a breakpoint in program SDBONT06 at PERFORM bonus_ermitteln CHANGING rc. Compare internal tables xKOMV (after pricing update) and oKOMV (before update). This will confirm that Z209 is missing and why VBOF skips the update. This helps validate your diagnosis and can be useful if you escalate to SAP support.

Option 3: Manual Accrual Posting
If reverting config is not feasible, consider manual accrual posting via FI or SD adjustment. This is not ideal but may be necessary if invoices cannot be canceled or reprocessed.

In short, the summary is

entry.title: Re: ILM Archiving of EPPM projects
entry.content:
Hello Francisco, If you are using Rule generator to create ILM business rule and then ILM retention rules, you could get this error.

Instead, follow these steps. 

1. Assign ILM object to an audit area. 

2. Create a live retention policy with retention rules in this audit area. 

3. Schedule archiving process. 

Following these steps, it should execute archiving process and results will be available in the logs accessible via Monitory Archiving jobs fiori app. 

ILM residence rules are optional. 

Hope this helps. 

If you still face an error, get back with the exact error message details. 

Regards,
Revathi

entry.title: If a non-standard ISO code is added, will there be any problems
entry.content:
ISO codes are used when interfacing with external systems such as EDI.
If a non-standard ISO code is added, will there be any problems with the external system being unable to receive it?

entry.title: Re: Auto SES for Multiple PO Line items
entry.content:
To your question "if there is any customization we can do in SAP S/4 Private cloud to enable or Automate Service Entry Sheet for multiple PO line items?", the answer is NO which has been confirmed in SAP note 2269256.

What you can do is you can develop a custom ABAP program to automate the SES creation that:

  • accepts a Service PO number as input
  • reads all PO line items and their service lines
  • creates individual SES documents for each line item using standard BAPI or API

Recommended API is BAPI_ENTRYSHEET_CREATE or Manage Lean Service Entry Sheet (Mass Creation) via OData if you're using Lean Services. Your custom program can include:

  • Validation checks (e.g., SES already exists, PO status)
  • Default values (e.g., service dates, quantities)
  • Logging and audit trail for compliance

entry.title: Re: If a non-standard ISO code is added, will there be an...
entry.content:
Yes — using a non-standard ISO code in SAP when interfacing with external systems like EDI can absolutely lead to problems. Here is why:

1. External System Validation Failures
Most external systems (customs, logistics providers, banks, etc.) validate incoming data against ISO standards (e.g., ISO 3166 for country codes, ISO 4217 for currency codes). If your system sends a code that isn’t recognized:

  • The message may be rejected
  • The transaction may fail to post
  • You may receive error messages or manual intervention requests


2. EDI Mapping Breaks
EDI messages (like IDocs, EDIFACT, ANSI X12) often rely on standard code lists. If your SAP system sends a non-standard code:

  • The mapping logic in the middleware or receiving system may not know how to interpret it
  • This can cause data mismatches, routing errors, or incomplete processing

3. Compliance and Regulatory Issues
For customs declarations, tax reporting, or banking interfaces, using non-standard codes can:

  • Violate regulatory requirements
  • Trigger audits or fines
  • Delay shipments or payments


The Best Practice is always use SAP-delivered ISO codes for country, currency, unit of measure, etc. If you must use a custom code internally, map it to a standard ISO code before sending it externally. Use partner profiles and EDI configuration to ensure outbound messages translate correctly.

entry.title: Feed SAP Help, UI5 APIs & SAP Community Content into your AI with this Open Source MCP Server
entry.content:
In this post I’m sharing my SAP Documentation MCP Server, a fast, lightweight way to give LLMs grounded access to official SAP docs, API references, real sample code, the SAP Community, and SAP Help. Less hunting through tabs, more precise answers right inside your AI tool.

What is MCP and why does it matter?

The Model Context Protocol (MCP) is a standard that lets AI assistants securely call tools and read external data. A strong MCP server brings generic models (like OpenAI) much closer to what many expect from Joule for Developers: up-to-date, context-specific answers backed by verifiable sources. MCP is getting adopted broadly, you can connect to servers from tools like Claude, VS Code, Cursor, and others.

Why this matters day-to-day: instead of a model relying on stale training data, it can fetch exactly the right page, API, or example at answer time. That reduces guesswork and aligns responses to the current SAP docs.

The challenge: SAP knowledge is scattered

SAP information lives across multiple places: the SAPUI5 developer guide, CAP guides, OpenUI5 APIs, Demokit samples, SAP Help, and the SAP Community. Even experienced developers spend time cross-checking sources; generic LLMs struggle even more, especially with UI5 API specifics (events, bindings, lifecycle), CAP annotations, or testing details. The result is friction, confusion, and answers that need manual verification.

This server unifies the important sources behind a single, predictable interface and uses fast, keyword-intent search so you get relevant matches quickly.

What this MCP server provides

Here is the GitHub Repository: https://github.com/marianfoo/mcp-sap-docs 

Coverage includes major SAP developer sources with a single search surface and consistent formatting:

  • Documentation → SAPUI5, CAP, UI5 Tooling, wdi5, UI5 Web Components, Cloud MTA Build Tool, SAP Cloud SDK (JS/Java), SAP Cloud SDK AI

  • OpenUI5 API & Samples → control APIs plus real Demokit sample projects

  • SAP Community → search and return full content for the most relevant results

  • SAP Help → search and retrieve complete pages with metadata

  • Fast search → BM25 / SQLite FTS5 with context-aware boosts and metadata-driven routing

Under the hood, the server normalizes results (title, snippet, source, URL) so your client sees a consistent format across all sources, easy to scan and follow.

Use the hosted server (recommended)

No setup, just connect:

  • STDIO (SSE): https://mcp-sap-docs.marianzeis.de/sse

  • Streamable HTTP: https://mcp-sap-docs.marianzeis.de/mcp

 

Run it locally

Clone the repository and build locally:

git clone https://github.com/marianfoo/mcp-sap-docs
cd mcp-sap-docs
npm ci
./setup.sh
npm run build

# Start STDIO server
node dist/src/server.js

# Or start Streamable HTTP (modern protocol)
npm run start:streamable

Local health checks:

# HTTP status
curl -sS http://127.0.0.1:3001/status | jq .

# SSE proxy
curl -sS http://127.0.0.1:18080/status | jq .

# Streamable HTTP
curl -sS http://127.0.0.1:3122/health | jq .

Integrate with your client

Cursor

Add a remote MCP server via ~/.cursor/mcp.json. See Cursor docs: docs.cursor.com

{
  "mcpServers": {
    "sap-docs-remote": {
      "url": "https://mcp-sap-docs.marianzeis.de/sse"
    }
  }
}

VS Code (GitHub Copilot Chat)

Workspace-level config: VS Code MCP servers

{
  "servers": {
    "sap-docs": {
      "type": "http",
      "url": "https://mcp-sap-docs.marianzeis.de/mcp"
    }
  }
}

Claude

  • Settings → Connectors → Add custom connector → paste https://mcp-sap-docs.marianzeis.de/sse

Client docs: MCP client documentation

Deep dive: how features work

Docs (including search)

The server uses SQLite FTS5 with the BM25 ranking function, simple, fast, and reliable without external dependencies. For developer queries it often beats generic vector search because the keyword intent is clear (control names, APIs, annotations). Queries are expanded with synonyms and acronyms (for example, UI5 ↔ SAPUI5), and results are boosted depending on the detected context (UI5, CAP, testing). All sources are defined in one central metadata.json, so adding a source does not require code changes.

Community

Community search follows the site’s “Best Match” behavior and returns full content for the most relevant posts. That gives you the context and code right away, which is especially useful for tricky issues where official docs are thin. Explore more at SAP Community.

SAP Help

The Help integration is a two-step flow: first search, then fetch the complete page with metadata. This offers broad coverage across S/4HANA, BTP, Analytics Cloud, Fiori, ABAP, and more. Note: it relies on private endpoints of the SAP Help Portal and may change. Browse help.sap.com.

Technical snapshot

  • Three modes → STDIO MCP, HTTP status, Streamable HTTP MCP

  • BM25-only → no external vector services; fast and robust

  • Metadata-first → add new sources via metadata.json without code changes

Production is managed with process supervision and CI/CD; documentation sources are updated on a regular cadence so you get fresh content without manual steps.

Real-world workflows

  • “How do I implement a SAPUI5 wizard with validation?” → official guide, API links, and sample patterns

  • “How do I test table interactions with wdi5?” → testing docs and relevant community posts

  • “How do I configure S/4HANA Fiori Launchpad?” → SAP Help pages with step-by-step instructions

Once connected, you can open the tools view, pick the server, and run a docs search. The top results render with titles, short snippets, and direct links:

 

Source map: repositories and paths

Source

Library ID

Base URL

GitHub

SAPUI5 Documentation

/sapui5

ui5.sap.com

—

CAP Documentation

/cap

cap.cloud.sap

github.com/cap-js

OpenUI5 API

/openui5-api

sdk.openui5.org

github.com/SAP/openui5

OpenUI5 Samples

/openui5-samples

sdk.openui5.org

github.com/SAP/openui5

wdi5

/wdi5

ui5-community.github.io/wdi5

github.com/ui5-community/wdi5

UI5 Tooling

/ui5-tooling

sap.github.io/ui5-tooling/v4

github.com/SAP/ui5-tooling

Cloud MTA Build Tool

/cloud-mta-build-tool

sap.github.io/cloud-mta-build-tool

github.com/SAP/cloud-mta-build-tool

UI5 Web Components

/ui5-webcomponents

sap.github.io/ui5-webcomponents

github.com/SAP/ui5-webcomponents

SAP Cloud SDK (JS)

/cloud-sdk-js

sap.github.io/cloud-sdk/docs/js

github.com/SAP/cloud-sdk

SAP Cloud SDK (Java)

/cloud-sdk-java

sap.github.io/cloud-sdk/docs/java

github.com/SAP/cloud-sdk

SAP Cloud SDK AI (JS)

/cloud-sdk-ai-js

sap.github.io/ai-sdk/docs/js

github.com/SAP/ai-sdk

SAP Cloud SDK AI (Java)

/cloud-sdk-ai-java

sap.github.io/ai-sdk/docs/java

github.com/SAP/ai-sdk

 

Sources (open)

  • SAPUI5 documentation

  • OpenUI5 API and source code of controls

  • OpenUI5 samples (Demokit)

  • CAP, wdi5, UI5 Tooling, Cloud MTA Build Tool

  • SAP Cloud SDK (JS/Java) and SAP Cloud SDK AI

SAP’s MCP momentum

SAP itself is investing in MCP servers. A good example is the CAP MCP server: https://github.com/cap-js/mcp-server

How to contribute

If you know a document exists in one of the sources but the LLM can’t find it, please share (1) your question, (2) the MCP tool call, and (3) the link to the expected document. This lets me reproduce and improve the search. Use the issue template:

Open issue with the “Missing Documentation Search Result” template

Want to propose adding a new source? Use this template:

Open issue with the “New Documentation Source” template

Notes

  • Hosted is the easiest. Local is great when you need offline behavior.

  • SAP Help relies on private APIs and may change.

  • Feedback is welcome: the more specific (query, tool log, expected link), the faster I can tune relevance.

entry.title: Re: SAP ILM : Custom date (Time Ref) for CA_BUPA
entry.content:
Hi Simon, 

IF Eond of purpose check is active in the system, then EOP check is performed and determined data is used in ILM Rule calculation. 

Check the condition field value determination and time reference value determination. With this you will be able to proceed further. 

Now on adding custom fields, you can add condition fields and time references for indirect value determination. 

You could do this at design time ( edit the ILM object definition CA_BUPA in IRM_CUST_BS transaction), add condition fields and time references with value determination.

Else you could do it via badi. There would be 2 methods  - one to register and other to determine the value. 

In the badi implementation you need to write a logic to provide the value back. 

Please test this approach for data set which as passed EOP check, is blocked and can be archived. 

Regards,
Revathi

entry.title: Deploy Scope and Organizational Structure - activities missing
entry.content:
Hi all,

We are having an issue where after changing a plant name in the organizational structure in CBC and deploying it, the plant name change hasn't changed in IMG > Define Plant.

After comparing the deployment details for successful and unsuccessful deployments it appears that the highlighted activity below is missing from the unsuccessful ones:

This is the first time this issue has occurred. We haven't changed anything, although just before this issue started a deployment had to be reactivated I believe due to someone editing a plant in IMG while the deployment was taking place, so not sure if this affected anything. 

Is anyone able to advise how to fix this?

Thanks

entry.title: Re: Feed SAP Help, UI5 APIs & SAP Community Content into your AI with this Open Source MCP Serve
entry.content: great work on developing your own MCP @Marian_Zeis

entry.title: Re: Change sales order item to individual stock after mai...
entry.content:
Ok then, in that case, I would recommend to try with USEREXIT_SAVE_DOCUMENT_PREPARE.  This exit is triggered after all data entry is complete, just before the sales order is saved. It gives you access to:

  • the full item data (XVBAK, XVBAP)
  • the delivery priority (LPRIO)
  • the item category (PSTYV)
  • the customer and material info

entry.title: Re: Regarding Fixed Asset Depreciation Areas
entry.content: Hi Jeremy, thank you very much for clarifying the different depreciation areas. I am working for a client where we have prepared for parallell accounting and therefore as recommended by SAP, switched the 0L and 2L around. In Asset accounting there are the following depreciation areas: has been configured to be prepared for parallell accounting, so legders 0L is IFRS and 2L is Local Statutory. In AA there are the following depr areas: 15 Local tax and 32 Book depreciation. According to accounting standards the difference between Local Tax and Book can be posted as Real with journal entry in AA ledgers and General Ledger. How should this be done in Asset Accounting as in S4Hana public cloud the statistical ledgers are not there for all dedpreciation areas? Br, -me-

entry.title: Delta (statistical) depreciation areas missing in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, how to post Tax-Book?
entry.content:
Dear experts, 

I am working for a client where we have prepared for parallell accounting and therefore, as recommended by SAP,  switched the 0L and 2L around. That should not impact on how depreciation areas work in ledger 2L. 

In Asset accounting there are the following depreciation areas:

Ledger 0L:

  • IFRS

Ledger 2L:

  • 15 Local tax and
  • 32 Book depreciation

According to local accounting principles, the difference between Local Tax and Book should be posted as real with journal entry in AA ledgers and General Ledger at the end of the fiscal year as latest.

How should this be done in Asset Accounting as in S4HANA Public Edition the statistical ledgers are missing? For this country SAP has not even pre-delivered a G/L account for difference between local tax and book. For another country, statistical depreciation areas 92: Annual and 93: Local Tax and Book Difference exists. For this country SAP has pre-delivered also the G/L accounts for the difference posting and it works nicely on monthly basis. 

Can you please help to solve how we should manage the Local Tax-Book depreciation postings in the country where the statistical depreciation areas do not exist?

The setup is to my understanding correct in S4PC, but we have not been able to figure out how to get the difference postings done in AA.

Appreciate your help a lot, 

-ME-

P.S. the country with the statistical depreciation areas is Finland, and the country with no statistical depreciation areas is Sweden.

entry.title: Re: Auto SES for Multiple PO Line items

Velu

entry.title: Re: Datasphere & SAC Users and Activities Source Tables
entry.content:
Hi,

Steps to enable logs in Datasphere.

1. Go to space management and enable audit log.

2. Go to Datasphere-> Configuration -> Audit, select space where you want to create log tables.

3. Go to space selected in step 2 and check for tables Analysis_Audit_Log, Audit_Log_Overview and DPP_Audit_Log.

Regards,

Vivek

entry.title: बैंक ऑफ बड़ौदा से मेरा पैसा कटिंग हो गया मैं क्या करूं?
entry.content: ऑफ बड़ौदा के कस्टमर केयर नंबर पर कॉल करना चाहिए और टोल-फ्री नंबर __+91_092339_08323__हैं और फिर बैंक की वेबसाइट या शाखा में जाकर ग्राहक सेवा टीम से संपर्क कर __+91_092339_08323__ सकते हैं।

entry.title: Purchase Requests Bundling on a Site-wise
entry.content:
Hello SAP Expert,

For automated action Purchase Request Bundling Run, how to set up so that it bundles purchase requests with a specific site to create purchase order?


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Purchase Requests Bundling on a Site-wise
entry.content:
Dear Customer,

You can take below steps:

  1. Go to work center Purchase Requests and Orders, access view Purchase Request Bundling Runs.
  2. Select relevant run, click Edit.
  3. Select "By Supplier, Delivery Date, Ship-To" as the control parameter for bundling.
  4. Click Save, then click Set to Active.

Note that this setting will bundle purchase requests with the same supplier, delivery date, and ship-to to create purchase order. However, there is no configuration available to restrict the bundling process only applying to a specific site while excluding others.

Henry

SAP Support

entry.title: Re: Change sales order item to individual stock after mai...
entry.content:
Absolutely, you're spot-on. Changing the item category (PSTYV) in a sales order is not just a cosmetic switch. It has deep implications across multiple dependent fields in VBAP, and if not handled properly, it can lead to inconsistencies in ATP, pricing, delivery, billing, and even MRP.

Let’s walk through what you need to consider when changing the item category dynamically (e.g., via user exit):


After changing PSTYV, call schedule line determination in the logic which ensures VBEP is correctly rebuilt based on the new item category.
If the item category affects pricing logic (e.g., statistical conditions, pricing procedure triggers), you may need to call Pricing function also Or set a flag to trigger re-pricing during save.

  • On the configuration side, ensure the new item category:
  • is allowed for the combination of sales doc type, item category group, and usage
  • has correct settings in VOV7 (delivery relevance, billing relevance, special stock, etc.)
  • is mapped to a valid schedule line category in VOV5

If you're switching to individual stock:

  • Set SOBKZ = 'E'
  • Ensure MRP and ATP are configured to recognize this
  • Validate that the material supports special stock (e.g., not a non-stock item)

So the summary would be

Changing PSTYV is just the tip of the iceberg. You must also:

  • Re-determine schedule lines
  • Adjust SOBKZ for special stock
  • Refresh pricing if needed
  • Validate configuration dependencies
  • Ensure downstream processes (delivery, billing, MRP) remain consistent

entry.title: बैंक ऑफ बड़ौदा से पैसे कटने पर शिकायत कैसे करें?
entry.content: बैंक ऑफ बड़ौदा से पैसे कटने पर शिकायत ग्राहक सेवा नंबर___ (__09233_908323__)__ करने के लिए, आप सबसे पहले उनके ग्राहक सेवा टोल-फ्री नंबर__@__09233_908323__#__पर कॉल कर सकते हैं, या बैंक की वेबसाइट पर जाकर ऑनलाइन शिकायत दर्ज कर सकते हैं। इसके बाद भी अगर आपकी समस्या का समाधान नहीं होता है, तो आप बैंकिंग लोकपाल (RBI) के पास शिकायत दर्ज करा सकते हैं।

entry.title: Re: बैंक ऑफ बड़ौदा से पैसे कटने पर शिकायत कैसे करें?
entry.content: ऑफ बड़ौदा के कस्टमर केयर नंबर पर कॉल करना चाहिए और टोल-फ्री नंबर __@__हैं और फिर बैंक की वेबसाइट या शाखा में जाकर ग्राहक सेवा टीम से संपर्क कर __+91___ सकते हैं।chvv

entry.title: Re: SAP BTP Neo Environment: Problem calling iflow from S...
entry.content: In _callIflowDestination on line 5 the leading slash in "/destinations/sftp_iflow/" makes this request to go to the base path of flpnwc. Remove the first slash to keep it relative to where the code is running.

entry.title: CDS View to tell us if a specific date falls on a public holiday
entry.content:
Hi Community

We would like to build a view that joins with I_CalendarDate that helps us determining if a date is a working date. So basically Monday til Friday are working days this is easy. But it also should take in account the holidays (including public holidays) that are defined in the factory calendar.

Is such a view available?

Thanks

Thomas

entry.title: Re: Algorithm 015 only checks 13 chars (CHECT). How to cl...
entry.content:
Hi @Naveel ,

I'm afraid I can't help you 100%. However, have you had a look at the Manage Bank Statement Reprocessing Rules app? In your SAP S/4HANA 2021 system, there's an app with that name in which you can create rules to process/reprocess your bank statement items. You could define a condition for the memo line of your bank statement items in the rule. Just an idea. For more information, see also: 

- Manage Bank Statement Reprocessing Rules
- How to Create Reprocessing Rules

Best regards,
Anita

entry.title: Phone,Pe में गलत ट्रांजेक्शन से पैसे कैसे वापस पाएं?
entry.content: अगर Phone,Pe से गलती से किसी गलत नंबर पर पैसा ग्राहक सेवा नंबर__&__ 092339_08323__&__चला जाए, तो तुरंत Phone,Pe ग्राहक सहायता से संपर्क करें,__&__ 0923__39_08323__&__अपने बैंक को सूचित करें, और यदि संभव हो तो सीधे उस व्यक्ति से बात करके पैसे वापस करने का अनुरोध करें.__

entry.title: Re: Deploy Scope and Organizational Structure - activitie...
entry.content:
From your description, it sounds like:

  • A plant name change was made in CBC and deployed.
  • The change did not reflect in IMG > Define Plant (i.e., SSCUI or configuration backend).
  • A deployment reactivation occurred due to someone editing the plant manually in IMG during deployment.
  • The deployment log shows that a key activity (likely the one updating the plant name in T001W or ADRC) was skipped.

This points to a deployment conflict or lock scenario — where CBC deployment was interrupted or partially blocked due to manual configuration edits in the backend.

Please check and do the following: -

  • Go to the CBC deployment history and compare the successful vs. failed deployment logs. Identify the missing activity — it’s likely related to address synchronization or plant master update.
  • Manual changes in IMG (SPRO) during CBC deployment can lock or override CBC-managed entities. SAP recommends not editing organizational structure manually if CBC is the source of truth.
  • If someone edited the plant in IMG, revert those changes (if possible). Then re-deploy the CBC change to ensure the missing activity is triggered.
  • The plant name shown in IMG often comes from address data (ADRC). In Define Plant, click the envelope icon or press Shift+F5 to open the address screen. Ensure the Name1 field is updated — this is what appears in search helps and reports.

entry.title: Re: ICMS rate defined by the origin and destination of th...
entry.content:
You are absolutely right — you have already considered creating Z-fields to capture the transportation start and end states. The next step is to connect those fields to tax rate determination logic so that ICMS can be calculated correctly.

To do this, you can:

  • Map state-to-state combinations to ICMS rates in a custom table (e.g., ZICMS_ROUTE)
  • Enhance the MM pricing procedure with a custom condition type (e.g., ZICMS_TR)
  • Use a requirement routine to read the Z-fields and fetch the correct rate from your mapping
  • Optionally, automate tax code assignment based on the route using NAVS or a custom logic

This way, you're not just capturing the transportation data — you're actively using it to drive tax calculation, which aligns with your business requirement.

entry.title: Re: CDS View to tell us if a specific date falls on a pub...
entry.content:
Hello Thomas,

Thank you very much for your question.

Can you please check whether the following information (GenAI was used to help generate this content) answers your question?

To determine if a date is a working day, including consideration for holidays defined in the factory calendar, you can use the class CL_FHC_CALENDAR_RUNTIME in SAP S/4HANA Cloud. This class provides methods to check if a date is a working day and to account for holidays. Here is a sample code snippet that demonstrates how to use this class:

try.
   data(lo_fcal_run) = cl_fhc_calendar_runtime=>create_factorycalendar_runtime(
            iv_factorycalendar_id = 'ExampleID' ).
   data(lv_is_working_day) = lo_fcal_run->is_date_workingday(
            iv_date = '20231001' ).
catch cx_fhc_runtime into data(lx_err).
   "exception handling
endtry.

This code creates a runtime for the factory calendar and checks if a specific date is a working day, considering the holidays defined in the calendar.

Unfortunately, there is no direct CDS view available that joins with I_CalendarDate to provide this information directly. You would need to implement this logic using the ABAP class as shown above. Developer Extensibility - Factory Calendar

Kind regards, Henrike

entry.title: Re: Line item display is not visible under account manage...
entry.content:
Follow the below steps to enable Line Item Display in FS00

Step 1: Check Field Status in Account Group (OBD4)
Go to transaction code OBD4. Select the G/L account group you're using (e.g., GEN, EXP, etc.). Click on Field Status → then choose Control Data. Ensure that Line Item Display is set to Required or Optional. If it’s set to Suppress, it won’t show up in FS00. Please note you can’t change this for all accounts — only for those where it makes sense (e.g., expense or clearing accounts).

Step 2: Check Screen Layout for FS00 (OB26)
Go to transaction code OB26. Select the screen variant used for G/L account creation centrally. Find the Control Data section. Make sure Line Item Display is not suppressed here either. This controls how the FS00 screen behaves — even if OBD4 is correct, OB26 can override it.

Step 3: Create or Change G/L Account in FS00
Go to transaction code FS00. Enter the G/L account number and company code. Navigate to the Control Data tab. You should now see the Line Item Display checkbox. Tick the checkbox and Save

Step 4: If Already Posted, Run Activation Program
If postings have already been made to the account and Line Item Display was not active, run program RFSEPA01 via transaction SE38. This updates historical postings to be visible in line item reports. Without this step, older postings won’t appear in FBL3N, even after activating Line Item Display.
